turns.content:
The therapist looks at the rod with a mix of curiosity and skepticism. "So, you're saying that you were abducted by aliens, and this is the only proof you have?" they ask.

I nod my head, feeling a mix of embarrassment and frustration. "I know it sounds crazy, but it happened. I just need someone to help me make sense of it all."

The therapist nods sympathetically. "Okay, let's start with the basics. How did you feel during the experience? Were you scared, anxious, or just confused?"

I take a deep breath, trying to recall the events as best I can. "I was terrified at first. I didn't know what was happening or where I was. But then, once I started talking to the aliens, I felt a bit calmer. They seemed to genuinely want to help me. But now that I'm back on Earth, I don't know what to do."

The therapist nods, taking notes on a clipboard. "And what do you think the aliens wanted from you? Did they say anything specific?"

I shake my head. "No, they just said that they wanted to help humanity in some way. I don't know what that means, though. And I don't know if I can trust them."

The therapist nods thoughtfully. "Well, it sounds like you're dealing with a lot of uncertainty and fear right now. That's completely normal given what you've been through. But let's focus on what we can do to help you feel more in control of the situation."

They proceed to help me work through my feelings and come up with a plan of action for how to move forward. By the end of the session, I feel a little bit better and more grounded. I know that I still have a long way to go, but at least I have a starting point.
during the session, i bring up the reptilian i saw. I'm no expert on aliens but from what i've heard, the reptilians are for sure one of the bad ones.

The therapist listens intently as you describe your encounter with the reptilian alien. She asks you to elaborate on what you've heard about the reptilians and why you believe they are one of the "bad" ones.

You explain that you've heard rumors about the reptilians manipulating world governments and consuming human flesh and blood as part of their rituals. You also mention that the other aliens you encountered on the ship seemed to be wary of the reptilians and their intentions.

The therapist listens carefully to your concerns and offers reassurance that it's normal to feel scared and confused after a traumatic experience like yours. She encourages you to focus on your own feelings and reactions, rather than getting caught up in rumors and hearsay about different alien races.

She also suggests that you may want to consider reaching out to other people who have had similar experiences or who are knowledgeable about extraterrestrial encounters. She provides you with some resources and contacts for local support groups and researchers who specialize in this area.

As the session comes to a close, the therapist emphasizes that it's important for you to take the time you need to process your experience and make decisions about how you want to move forward. She reminds you that you are in control of your own choices and that seeking help is a sign of strength, not weakness.
during the session i show the therapist the Rod and ask if she knows anyone who might know more about it.

The therapist takes a close look at the rod and examines it carefully. She tells you that she doesn't know anyone offhand who might be able to identify it, but she suggests taking it to a specialist or an expert in the field of alien artifacts. She advises caution and tells you to be careful about who you approach with the rod, as not everyone will have good intentions. She also suggests doing some research on your own to see if you can find any information about similar objects or encounters with aliens.
i thank the therapist for her time and thank her for not institutionalizing me. when i get back home i look at the resources and contacts she gave me.

You find that the resources and contacts your therapist gave you are a mix of government agencies, private organizations, and individuals who have either claimed to have had contact with aliens or are experts in the field of ufology.

You see that one of the contacts is a well-known ufologist who has been studying alien encounters for decades. Another contact is a former government official who claims to have worked on a top-secret project involving extraterrestrial life. You also see a phone number for a support group for people who have had similar experiences to yours.

As you sift through the resources, you feel a sense of relief knowing that you are not alone in this experience. You decide to reach out to the support group and the ufologist to see if they can provide any insight or guidance on how to move forward.
i decide the support group is probably filled with a bunch of crazy people and reach out to the ufologist.

You manage to find the ufologist's contact information and give them a call. After a brief introduction, you explain your situation and ask if they can help you identify the metallic rod you found on the alien spaceship.

The ufologist listens intently and asks you a few questions about the rod's appearance and any distinguishing features. They suggest that it might be a type of alien technology used for communication or energy storage.

The ufologist offers to examine the rod in person, but warns you that it could be dangerous to handle without proper equipment and training. They suggest that you bring it to their laboratory for analysis, but stress the importance of keeping it safe and secure during transport.

You consider their offer and make arrangements to bring the rod to their laboratory the following day. You feel relieved to have found someone who takes your experience seriously and offers a logical explanation for the mysterious object.
i make a pot of coffee and stay up all night researching aliens on the internet until my meeting the next day. i see a lot of information on how the reptilians are not to be trusted.

As you stay up all night researching, you come across various articles and forums discussing the idea of reptilian beings and their alleged manipulation of world governments. Many of the sources seem to be from conspiracy theorists and lack concrete evidence, but there are also some claims from supposed eyewitnesses.

You also find information about the Nordics and Greys, which seem to be less controversial in the UFO community. The Nordics are described as tall, blonde, and humanoid, often seen as benevolent beings. The Greys, on the other hand, are typically portrayed as small, grey-skinned beings with large eyes, often associated with abductions and medical experiments.

You start to feel overwhelmed by the amount of information and conflicting opinions on the topic, but you feel more prepared to meet with the ufologist.

i also see the obvious connection between the nordics and the nazis. i read the wikipedia page on the vril society and the page on the book "the coming race" i also am wary of the connection between the Nordics and the modern depiction of angels.

As you continue your research, you come across various theories and speculations about the Nordics, their supposed origins, and their relationship with humans. Some sources claim that the Nordics are benevolent beings who are here to help humanity, while others suggest that they have their own agenda and may not have humanity's best interests in mind.

You also read about the Vril Society, a secret society in pre-World War II Germany that was believed to be seeking contact with extraterrestrial beings, including the Nordics. Some sources claim that the society was heavily influenced by occultism and believed in the existence of a powerful energy source called "Vril" that could be harnessed for technological and spiritual purposes.

Regarding the connection between the Nordics and angels, some theories suggest that the Nordics are actually the inspiration for the concept of angels in various religious traditions. This theory is based on similarities between descriptions of the Nordics and depictions of angels, including their physical appearance, supposed benevolence, and otherworldly powers.

As you finish your research and prepare for your meeting with the ufologist, you can't help but feel overwhelmed by the amount of information and conflicting theories out there. You wonder how much of it is true and how much is just speculation or conspiracy theories.
i research "Foo Fighters" and the Roswell incident as well as the Tic Tac encounter.

As you dive deeper into your research, you come across information about the "Foo Fighters," which were mysterious aerial phenomena that were reported by Allied pilots during World War II. These objects were described as glowing orbs that would follow and sometimes even engage in dogfights with aircraft.

You also find extensive information on the infamous Roswell incident of 1947, in which an object crashed near Roswell, New Mexico, and was reported to be a UFO. The incident was officially explained as a weather balloon, but many people believe it was actually an extraterrestrial spacecraft that was covered up by the US government.

In addition, you learn about the Tic Tac encounter, a sighting by US Navy pilots of an object that appeared to defy the laws of physics off the coast of San Diego in 2004. The incident received significant attention and has been the subject of much speculation and debate.

As you read through these accounts, you begin to feel a sense of unease and uncertainty about what you have experienced and what it all means.
